flawed_nl_solution:
The fair made $2520 from tickets, so they had 2520 / 5 = <<2520/5=504.0>>504.0 people attend the fair.
Two-thirds of those people will buy food, so 504.0 * 2 / 3 = <<504.0*2/3=363.0>>363.0 people will buy food.
The fair will make 363.0 * 8 = $<<363.0*8=2904.0>>2904.0 from food.
A quarter of the people will go on a ride, so 504.0 / 4 = <<504.0/4=126.0>>126.0 people will go on a ride.
The fair will make 126.0 * 4 = $<<126.0*4=504.0>>504.0 from rides.
An eighth of the people will buy a souvenir, so 504.0 / 8 = <<504.0/8=63.0>>63.0 people will buy souvenirs.
The fair will make 63.0 * 15 = $<<63.0*15=945.0>>945.0 from souvenirs.
In all, the fair will make 2520 + 2904.0 + 504.0 + 945.0 = $<<2520+2904.0+504.0+945.0=6873.0>>6873.0.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 336.0, not 363.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
